pageContext.claim: “I don't know very much about her. I know that supposedly she was very partisan and she was a Clinton-type person. But whether or not she keeps the job, I'd leave that up to Mike Pompeo.”
pageContext.analysis: Ambassador Marie ­Yovanovitch, who Trump fired from her post in Ukraine, is a highly respected foreign service officer who has served under presidents of both parties. Yovanovitch was ambassador to Kyrgyzstan under President George W. Bush, ambassador to Armenia from 2008 to 2011 under Bush and President Barack Obama, and ambassador to Ukraine since August 2016. There is no evidence she is a "Clinton-type person."
